plugin.name: ðŸ“¦ Filer
plugin.description: Help file (move) the current paragraph, selected paragraphs, or heading and its section, to different notes. Please see details for more, err, details.
plugin.author: jgclark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo_NEXT: 1.4.0: ??? New '/smart duplicate note' and '/smart file to completed sections' commands.
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
1.3.0: New '/move paragraph and children' command.
1.2.1: More useful choose note dialog in 'move...' commands. Fix regressions.
1.2.0: Allow '/add sync'd copy to note' command to work on multiple lines.
1.1.6: move /new note commands to NoteHelpers plugin. Updated folder chooser. Fix to /move commands.
1.1.5: try to fix /move paras occasionally not deleting from original
1.1.4: try to fix a race condition in /add sync'd copy to note. Fix to /move note link.
1.1.3: bug fix.
1.1.2: updating to newer libraries.
1.1.1: new create folder option.
1.1.0: new /archive... command. New '/... note links...' commands.

plugin.commands.name: add sync'd copy to note
plugin.commands.description: Add a sync'd copy of the current line(s) to a section in other note(s)

plugin.commands.name: archive note keeping folder structure
plugin.commands.description: Move the current note to NotePlan's Archive, but keep the same folder structure for it inside the special @Archive folder

plugin.commands.name: copy note links
plugin.commands.description: copies [[note link]] lines or blocks from the open calendar note to their respective project notes

plugin.commands.name: copy note links (recently changed)
plugin.commands.description: copies [[note link]] lines or blocks from recently-changed calendar notes to their respective project notes

plugin.commands.name: move note links
plugin.commands.description: moves [[note link]] lines or blocks from the open calendar note to their respective project notes

plugin.commands.name: move note links (recently changed)
plugin.commands.description: moves [[note link]] lines or blocks from recently-changed calendar notes to their respective project notes

plugin.commands.name: move paragraph and children
plugin.commands.description: moves this paragraph and all its children (directly indented) to a different note

plugin.commands.name: move paragraph or selection
plugin.commands.description: moves this paragraph (or selected paragraphs) to a different note

plugin.commands.name: move paragraph block
plugin.commands.description: moves all paragraphs in the current block to a different note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Today's note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to Today's note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Tomorrow's note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to Tomorrow's daily note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Weekly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to the current Weekly note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Next Weekly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to Next Week's note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Monthly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to the current Monthly note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Next Monthly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to Next Week's note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Quarterly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to the current Quarterly note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Next Quarterly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move a block of paragraphs to Next Quarter's note

plugin.commands.name: Filer: update plugin settings
plugin.commands.description: Settings interface (even for iOS)

plugin.commands.name: smart duplicate note
plugin.commands.description: from the current regular note create a new one that uses the same structure of headings, and moves over any open tasks/checklists, and sorts the new note.

plugin.commands.name: smart file to completed sections
plugin.commands.description: ???from the current regular note create a new one that uses the same structure of headings, and moves over any open tasks/checklists, and sorts the new note.
arguments: filename of note to work on

plugin.settings.title: Include lines from start of Section in the Block?
plugin.settings.description: Controls whether all the lines in the current heading's section are included in the block to move (true) or whether only the following ones that are more deeply indented are included (false; this is the default).

plugin.settings.title: Use a tighter definition of when a Block finishes?
plugin.settings.description: By default a Block includes blank lines and separators. If you wish those to instead mark the end of a Block, then set this to true.

plugin.settings.title: Allow preamble before first heading?
plugin.settings.description: If set, some 'preamble' lines are allowed directly after the title. When filing/moving/inserting items with these commands, this preamble will be left in place, up to and including the first blank line, heading or separator. Otherwise the first heading will be directly after the note's title line (or frontmatter if used).

plugin.settings.title: Where to add in section
plugin.settings.description: Controls whether moved/copied lines get inserted: at the start or end of the chosen section.

plugin.settings.title: Add date reference?
plugin.settings.description: If true, adds date reference on moved paragraph(s) when moved from a daily note.

plugin.settings.title: Date reference style
plugin.settings.description: The style of added date reference on a moved note: add either 'link' ('>date') or 'at' ('@date') or 'date' (a formatted date string).

plugin.settings.title: "/add sync'd copy to note" command settings
Default section Heading to sync lines to
plugin.settings.description: (optional) If set, this avoids the question of which heading you want to '/add sync'd copy' to. (Note: needs to include the relevant number of '#' heading markers.)

plugin.settings.title: Where to add a new heading in the note
plugin.settings.description: If the default heading doesn't yet exist in the note, this controls whether it will first be added at the start or end of the note.

plugin.settings.title: Types of lines to file
plugin.settings.description: By default these commands file all lines that contain a [[note link]] (or blocks that start with a [[note link]] line). But you can select different subsets of lines to move or copy.

plugin.settings.title: Where to add in the note
plugin.settings.description: If the [[note link]] doesn't include a heading, then this controls whether filed lines get inserted at the start or end of the note.

plugin.settings.title: File the rest of a block the note link is in?
plugin.settings.description: If set, this command will include the block following this line: any indented lines, or (if this line is a heading) all lines following until a blank line, or heading of the same level or higher. Default is not to use blocks, which only files this line.

plugin.settings.title: Tag that indicates a [[note link]] should be ignored
plugin.settings.description: If this tag (e.g. '#ignore') is included in a line with a [[note link]] then it (and where relevant the rest of its block) will not be moved or copied.

plugin.settings.title: How many days to include in 'recent' changes to calendar notes?
plugin.settings.description: When looking for note links to file, this sets how many days' worth of changes to calendar notes to include? To include all days, set to 0.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).
